elements.title: Jean-Emmanuel Depraz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jean-Emmanuel Depraz (pictured) won a Magic: The Gathering world championship using three cards depicting the player who beat him in 2021?

elements.title: Modi'in (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ancient Jewish town of Modi'in housed a monumental mausoleum for the Hasmonean family, built in the 2nd century BC, that remains undiscovered?

elements.title: Kassiane Asasumasu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kassiane Asasumasu coined the term neurodivergent in 2000?

elements.title: motivation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that having specific rather than vague goals tends to increase motivation and performance?

elements.title: Tilmann Köhler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tilmann Köhler directed Mozart's Le nozze di Figaro in 2023 with playful "serious games" in which the women win by "wit, cleverness and presence of mind"?

elements.title: Liberty Christian Preparatory School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although some of the players on Liberty Christian Preparatory School's eight-man football team had never played tackle football before, the team won the state championship in its first season?

elements.title: Hildegard Temporini-Gräfin Vitzthum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hildegard Temporini-Gräfin Vitzthum arrived at the University of Tübingen as a student in 1959, and remained there until her death in 2004?

elements.title: Ariana Grande's song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ariana Grande's song about Saturn returns, as well as SZA's and Kacey Musgraves's, were coincidentally released just weeks apart?

elements.title: Trumpet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the phrase "togs, togs, undies" was popularised in New Zealand by an advertisement for Trumpet ice cream cones?
